question.text: Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?

options.text: Rhodopsin is the purplish red protein present in rods only.
Retinal is the light absorbing portion of visual photo pigments.
In retina, the rods have the photo pigment rhodopsin while cones have three different    photopigments.
Retinal is a derivative of Vitamin C

solution.text: The retina consists of three layers. The innermost layer is the ganglionic layer, bipolar layer and photoreceptors. Photoreceptors consist of rods and cones. Rods contain protein rhodopsin, which is purplish-red protein, while cones contain three different types of photopigments. These photoreceptors consist of retinal and opsin. Retinal is that part that absorbs light and it is a derivative of Vitamin A.
